meanings.definition: The practice of lending money at unreasonably high rates of interest.
meanings.sent1: The usuriousness of the loan shark's interest rates left borrowers struggling to make ends meet.
meanings.sent2: The bank was accused of usuriousness for charging exorbitant interest on small personal loans.
meanings.sent3: The usuriousness of the moneylender was so extreme that even fictional characters would find it unbelievable.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes widened in disbelief as she read the contract, shocked by the usuriousness of the terms.
meanings.sent5: The usuriousness of the deal was like a dark cloud hanging over their financial future.

meanings.definition: The state of being excessively greedy or exploitative in financial dealings.
meanings.sent1: His usuriousness knew no bounds as he exploited vulnerable customers for personal gain.
meanings.sent2: The company's usuriousness was evident in their relentless pursuit of profit at any cost.
meanings.sent3: The usuriousness of the businessman was so extreme that even his competitors were taken aback.
meanings.sent4: She felt suffocated by the usuriousness of the corporate world, where greed seemed to reign supreme.
meanings.sent5: The usuriousness of their actions painted a grim picture of the financial industry's ethics.
